Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no evidence or historical record of Thomas Jefferson saying the quoted statement.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by stating that the quote was fabricated and falsely attributed to Thomas Jefferson.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the quote is not found in Jefferson's writings or anywhere else in the historical record.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the quote is attributed to Thomas Jefferson without any evidence to support it.
